CalendarRemindersProxy * mpCalendarRemindersProxy

Detailed Description

Constants and helpers for the Calendar Reminder and Alert table.

The following example demonstrates how to use the CalendarReminders

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     // new Context instance
     Context* context = new Context(this);

     // new CalendarReminders
     CalendarReminders reminders(*context);

     //add value
     ContentValues cv;
     cv.addValue(CalendarReminders::Reminders::METHOD(), 0);
     reminders.add(CalendarReminders::CALENDAR_REMINDERS_URI(), cv);

     //set value
     ContentValues cv2;
     cv2.addValue(CalendarReminders::Alerts::STATE(), CalendarReminders::STATE_FIRED);
     reminders.set(CalendarReminders::CALENDAR_ALERTS_URI(), cv2, "_ID=0", NULL);

     //get value
     Cursor* results = reminders.getN(CalendarReminders::CALENDAR_REMINDERS_URI(),
         NULL,
         CalendarReminders::Alerts::CALENDAR_ALERTS_URI() + "=0",
         NULL,
         NULL);

     if (results != NULL && results->moveToFirst()) {
         do {
             // ...do something
         } while (results->moveToNext());
     }

     //remove value
     reminders.remove(CalendarReminders::CALENDAR_ALERTS_URI(), "_ID=0", NULL);

     delete results;
     delete context;
 }

Definition at line 75 of file CalendarReminders.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::content::CalendarReminders::AlertStates

Alert states default value.

Enumerator:
STATE_SCHEDULED 

An alert begins in this state when it is first created.

STATE_FIRED 

After a notification for an alert has been created it should be updated to fired.

STATE_DISMISSED 

Once the user has dismissed the notification the alert's state should be set to dismissed so it is not fired again.

Definition at line 275 of file CalendarReminders.h.

Enumerator:

Method default.

Method alert.

METHOD_EMAIL 

Method email.

METHOD_SMS 

Method sms.

METHOD_ALARM 

Method alarm.

METHOD_NONE 

Method none.

METHOD_CUSTOM_SMS 

Method custom sms.

enum gaia::content::CalendarReminders::RemindersMinutesDefault

Reminders minutes default value.

Enumerator:
REMINDERS_MINUTES_DEFAULT 

Passing this as a minutes value will use the default reminder minutes.

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::CalendarReminders::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
base::StringArray *const  selection,
base::String *const  where,
base::StringArray *const  whereArgs,
base::String *const  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
void gaia::content::CalendarReminders::rescheduleMissedAlarms ( )

Deprecated, you should not call this API directly in normal case.

Searches the CalendarAlerts table for alarms that should have fired but have not and then reschedules them. This method can be called at boot time to restore alarms that may have been lost due to a phone reboot.

void gaia::content::CalendarReminders::scheduleAlarm ( int64_t  alarmTime)

Deprecated, you should not call this API directly in normal case.

Schedules an alarm that will notify listeners when a reminder should be fired. The provider will keep scheduled reminders up to date but apps may use this to implement snooze functionality without modifying the reminders table. Scheduled alarms will generate an intent using

Parameters:
alarmTimeThe time to fire the intent in UTC millis since epoch
